message: How google traffic work in Egypt without using any cams to track traffic flow or using any governmental sources ?

data.message: Millions of Android phones are moving in our streets, this is more than enough
Abdelhameed Tourky you need always on GPS and 3G connection for all these phones is google collecting data in background with that accuracy to determine speed changes and not only locations/streets?

a good portion of those millions have their GPS and 3G working, and to verify the data from those phones, you can use the phones which have 3G working only, to get a low accuracy location and feed the traffic system even more!
It depends on history of travels plus real time GPS tracking, btw egypt has around 92M phone, around 37% are  smartphones and increasing
Google maps now tracks traffic?  O_o?

Dina El Shaer I didn't get what the history of travel means if you are talking about internal caching locations it won't be that accurate to collect location data.Put your phone on turn by turn navigation and compare it to background location on settings if you turned everything on even 3G and notice battery consumption difference we are talking about this level of accuracy
The recently extended coverage ia probably a result of their Waze acquisition. At least I believe so. Not sure where the data is coming from though.
who told you they don't use can ?
i think it depends on historical data plus current devices on the road

I know about this permission and ability to track in background Fitness apps uses it on all platforms for a while but what I meant that it's not that accurate like in app API to detect location variations like speed ðŸ˜„
Ahmed A. Ibrahim historical means you have zero knowledge if there is an accident on road it will appear as green if data says so.
I do believe they use variety of metrics and data which can combining with AI and traffic patterns to feed certain algorithm.

Many of the comments here are really good, but did anyone tried to ask Google how they are doing this?

Yes, I work at Google, but I'm not authorized to answer such questions. Also, I want to encourage people to get solid info instead of guessing :)

data, lots of data from 3G/GPS even WiFi networks!!
that makes inaccuracy level very low

From Google Traffic's Wikipedia page [1]:
Google Traffic works by analyzing the GPS-determined locations transmitted to Google by a large number of mobile phone users. By calculating the speed of users along a length of road, Google is able to generate a live traffic map. Google processes the incoming raw data about mobile phone device locations, and then excludes anomalies such as a postal vehicle which makes frequent stops. When a threshold of users in a particular area is noted, the overlay along roads and highways on the Google map changes color.[2]

[1] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Google_Traffic
[2] https://www.ncta.com/platform/broadband-internet/how-google-tracks-traffic/

Some above explanations might describe the traffic tracking in urban or areas that have communications infrastructure but can Google tracking cars in remote desolated areas like deserts or forests or oceans?
Let's not forget about cell towers, their locations are known, may be they are used as well
